    boolean save​(java.lang.String file_name)
    Saves this weighted (directed) graph to the given file name - in JSON format
    java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
    returns the the shortest path between src to dest - as an ordered List of nodes: src--> n1-->n2-->...dest see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shortest_path_problem Note if no such path --> returns null; create a new list object if the shortestPathDist function return -1 we return null if the shortestPathDist function return 0 we return list we one node we check if the two nodes exist in the graph, in case they exist we explore the graph by Dijkstra's and update the tag in the length of the path from source node to the destination node
    double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
    returns the length of the shortest path between src to dest if source node is null or the destination node is null return -1 if src equal to dest and the vertex in the graph the length of the path is 0 else we check if the two nodes exist in the graph in case they exist in the graph we run by Dijkstra's and update the tag in the length of the path from source node to the destination node

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Returns true if and only if (iff) there is a valid path from each node to each other node. NOTE: assume directional graph (all n*(n-1) ordered pairs). is connected : in a given graph if the size of vertexes is equal to 0/1 that means there is an edge between each and every vertex to another (in case size=1 the vertex is connected to itself by definition). otherwise the Dijkstra's algorithm We created an inverted graph and tested it on both types of graphs from the same vertex after that we run by all the vertex and if we get that the tag equals to 0 return false else return true we use auxiliary function
      Specified by:
      isConnected in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Returns:
      true - if there is a valid path from each node to each other node, false if isn't

    • shortestPathDist

      public double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
      returns the length of the shortest path between src to dest if source node is null or the destination node is null return -1 if src equal to dest and the vertex in the graph the length of the path is 0 else we check if the two nodes exist in the graph in case they exist in the graph we run by Dijkstra's and update the tag in the length of the path from source node to the destination node
      Specified by:
      shortestPathDist in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node.
      dest - - end (target) node.
      Returns:
      w - the sum of the Weight by the path from src to dest.

    • shortestPath

      public java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
      returns the the shortest path between src to dest - as an ordered List of nodes: src--> n1-->n2-->...dest see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shortest_path_problem Note if no such path --> returns null; create a new list object if the shortestPathDist function return -1 we return null if the shortestPathDist function return 0 we return list we one node we check if the two nodes exist in the graph, in case they exist we explore the graph by Dijkstra's and update the tag in the length of the path from source node to the destination node
      Specified by:
      shortestPath in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node.
      dest - - end (target) node.
      Returns:
      list - the list of the vertex from src to dest.

    • save

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • load

      public boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
      This method load a graph to this graph algorithm. if the file was successfully loaded - the underlying graph of this class will be changed (to the loaded one), in case the graph was not loaded the original graph should remain "as is".
      Specified by:
      load in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      file - file name of JSON file
      Returns:
      true iff the graph was successfully loaded, false if isn't/
